bjpack

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • bjpack.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Game() holds most of Black's mechanics and generates most of the games elements for play. Specifically it generates the deck, the dealer, and the user elements for play.
    Author:
    Logan Crowe, Edward Johnson, Anthony Dowling

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Player dealer
      The dealer, a Player() object.
      private Deck mainDeck
      Game's Deck() object.
      private Player user
      The user, a Player() object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game()
      Game constructor.

      Game constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkNaturals()
      Check for natural wins.
      void dealerHitStay()
      Checks the hit/stay logic of playerHit() in Player(), and deals a card if true.
      Player getDealer()
      Get's the dealer.
      Deck getMainDeck()
      Gets the game's deck.
      Player getUser()
      Get's the user.
      void initialDeal()
      Deals out the first Card() objects to the user and dealer.
      void setMainDeck(Deck newDeck)
      Set's the game's deck to a given deck.
      void userHit()
      Called when the user 'hits', dealing them a new card.
      void userWinCheck()
      Called at the end of a round to determine the users win/loss/tie situation and calls the appropriate Player() method.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()
        Game constructor. Initializes aiPlayers, mainDeck, dealer and user.

      • Game

        public Game(int points)
        Game constructor. Initializes aiPlayers, mainDeck, dealer and user. Carries over point from previous round.
        Parameters:
        points - previous rounds point total.

        public final void dealerHitStay()
        Checks the hit/stay logic of playerHit() in Player(), and deals a card if true.

      • userWinCheck

        public final void userWinCheck()
        Called at the end of a round to determine the users win/loss/tie situation and calls the appropriate Player() method.
